CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 26, 1955, pg. 26, reads: "Neighborhood Clubs - The Hill City Clock Club organization has formed a Council of Neighborhood Clubs. First row, left to right: Mrs. Dorothy Harper, financial secretary; Mrs. Mattie Sharp, recording secretary; Edmond McKenzie, president; Mrs. Georgetta Stevens, vice president, and Mrs. Clara Brown.  Back row: Robert A. Ruffin, Mrs. Gladys Brown, corresponding secretary; Mrs. Clara Crumly, chaplain;  Mrs. Bessie Ponder, Mrs. Elizabeth Reed and Howard Wilson.  The council is another phase of the Hill City Block Club Association program.  Robert A. Ruffin is adviser."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Hill City Clock Club, first row from left: Dorothy Harper, Mattie Sharp, Edmond McKenzie, Georgetta Stevens, Clara Brown; back row: Robert A. Ruffin, Gladys Brown, Clara Crumly, Bessie Ponder, Elizabeth Reed, and Howard Wilson
